description: The Code Health Checker subsystem is an automated pipeline within the Codebase Analysis Tool that runs static analysis checks against a codebase, aggregates findings, and produces a comprehensive health report. It begins at a CLI entry point which parses arguments and loads initial configuration, hands control to an orchestrator that dispatches configurable static analysis checkers, uses standardized data models to represent findings and reports, and returns a final HealthReport to the caller. The subsystem manages configuration (including ignore rules), orchestrates multiple specialized checkers, and consolidates results into summaries and scores.

components.name: CLI Entry Point
components.description: Primary interface for initiating code health checks; parses CLI args, loads initial configuration, and delegates execution to the orchestrator.

components.name: Health Check Orchestrator
components.description: Core coordination engine that manages the lifecycle of checks, dispatches tasks to static analysis checkers, aggregates findings, computes health scores, and constructs the final HealthReport.

components.name: Health Check Data Models
components.description: Defines standardized data structures and schemas used in the health-check pipeline (e.g., findings, summaries, and the final HealthReport).

components.name: Health Check Configuration Manager
components.description: Loads and manages health-specific configuration, handles .healthignore exclusion patterns, and supplies configuration parameters and thresholds to other components.

components.name: Static Analysis Checkers
components.description: Pluggable modules that perform specific static analyses (e.g., orphan code, god class detection), producing findings and groups used by the orchestrator to compute health metrics.
